effect.name: Smartblur
effect.description: Blur the input video without impacting the outlines.
effect.author: libavfilter

parameter.name: av.lr
Luma radius
parameter.comment:
Set the luma radius.
The value specifies the variance of the gaussian filter used to blur the image (slower if larger).

parameter.name: av.ls
Luma strength
parameter.comment:
Set the luma strength.
The value configures the blurring. A positive value will blur the image, whereas a negative value will sharpen the image.

parameter.name: av.lt
Luma threshold
parameter.comment:
Set the luma threshold used as a coefficient
to determine whether a pixel should be blurred or not. A value of 0 will filter all the image, positive values will filter flat areas, negative values will filter edges.

parameter.name: av.cr
Chroma radius
parameter.comment:
Set the chroma radius.
The value specifies the variance of the gaussian filter used to blur the image (slower if larger). If not specified ,it defaults to the value set for Luma radius

parameter.name: av.cs
Chroma strength
parameter.comment:
Set the chroma strength.
The value configures the blurring. A positive value will blur the image, whereas a negative value will sharpen the image. If not specified, it defaults to the value set for Luma strength.

parameter.name: av.ct
Chroma threshold
parameter.comment:
Set the chroma threshold used as a coefficient
to determine whether a pixel should be blurred or not. A value of 0 will filter all the image, positive values will filter flat areas, negative values will filter edges. If not specified, it defaults to the value set for Luma threshold

parameter.name: av.ar
Alpha radius
parameter.comment:
Set the alpha radius.
The value specifies the variance of the gaussian filter used to blur the image (slower if larger). If not specified, it defaults to the value set for Luma radius

parameter.name: av.as
Alpha strength
parameter.comment:
Set the alpha strength.
The value configures the blurring. A positive value will blur the image, whereas a negative value will sharpen the image. If not specified, it defaults to the value set for Luma strength.

parameter.name: av.at
Alpha threshold
parameter.comment:
Set the alpha threshold used as a coefficient
to determine whether a pixel should be blurred or not. A value of 0 will filter all the image, positive values will filter flat areas, negative values will filter edges. If not specified, it defaults to the value set for Luma threshold
